title: conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Markets in
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the European Union (Markets in 

Financial Instruments) (Amendment) Regulations 2021. 

(2) These Regulations shall come into operation on 10 November 2021.
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited european union (markets financial instruments) (amendment) regulation 2021 (2) regulation shall come operation 10 november 2021

title: conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of
heading: 2. Regulation 4 of the European Union (Markets in Financial Instruments)
text_raw:
2. Regulation 4 of the European Union (Markets in Financial Instruments) 

Regulations 2017 (S.I. No. 375 of 2017) is amended in paragraph (1) – 

(a) by 

the substitution of 

the 

following subparagraph 

for 

subparagraph (t): 

“(t) branches of third country firms established in the State, save 

as otherwise provided for in Regulation 48;”, and 

(b) by the insertion of the following subparagraph after subparagraph 

(t): 

“(u) crowdfunding service providers as defined in point (e) of 
Article 2(1) of Regulation (EU) 2020/1503 of the European 
Parliament and of the Council.”. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

28 April, 2021. 

PASCHAL DONOHOE, 
Minister for Finance. 

1 OJ No. L 173, 12.6.2014, p. 349. 
2 OJ No. L 347, 20.10.2020, p. 50. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 30th April, 2021. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [203] 3

title: conferred on me by section 3 of the European Communities Act 1972 (No. 27 of
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations give effect to Directive (EU) 2020/1504 of the European 
Parliament and of the Council of 7 October 2020 amending Directive 
2014/65/EU on markets in financial instruments. 

Directive (EU) 2020/1504 provides that the Markets in Financial Instruments 
Directive (Directive 2014/65/EU or MiFID II) does not apply to crowdfunding 
service providers as defined in the Crowdfunding Regulation (Regulation (EU) 
2020/1503). 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [203]
